natural_language: If an agent A last observed a relevant condition S at time t₀ and is unaware of a change, A will assume S still holds at t₁.
If an object x appears to have property P and there’s no contrary cue, an agent A treats x as P.
Given a chosen plan π for a goal G, if an agent A isn’t aware of a new obstacle, A executes π unchanged.
If an agent A believes resource R meets requirement Q and knows of no defect, A uses R for Q.
If a reading or a report D is from a normally reliable source and an agent A lacks a reason to doubt it, A accepts D.
If an agent A saw claim C but not a later correction, A will reason or seek info as if C were still the topic or truth.
If a hazard H exists but an agent A doesn’t perceive or know it, A won’t mitigate H and will proceed as usual.
If an agent A needs precondition P for a goal G and believes an agent B can supply P while A can’t (or isn’t sure they can), A requests P from B.
